page.title: 01BARCOMBE SURVEY AREA.
page.content: {By Mr.Yeomans & Class 1. Our area is a rural community.It comprises of one main village Barcombe Cross,plus outlying farms and hamlets. The agricultural land is mainly cereal crops and grazing land for cattle.A small amount of land is used for seasonal soft fruits. Barcombe Cross is fortunate in its quiet location,due mainly to the exclusion of many major roads or housing developments.It has a mixture of private and rented accommodation of various ages,most being modern.It acts as a dormitory village for nearby Lewes and Brighton plus commuters to London. The local junior school was re_built in 1962 and is one of the focal points of the community.The hamlet of Barcombe is the original founding village and is mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1066 under its previous name_"Bercham".
